department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
short_summary: A tender for Baker Lake Perimeter Fence System in Nunavut
description: Natural Resources Canada has a requirement for a perimeter fence system as per the Statement of Requirement in the Request for Proposal. This procurement is conditionally limited to Canadian goods. Items to be delivered duty paid (DDP) to Ottawa, ON, for furtherance to Baker Lake, Nunavut.
full_summary:
### Title
> 23240-230245Request for Proposal (RFP) for Baker Lake Perimeter Fence System

### Tender Information
| Section | Information |
| --- | --- |
| Reference Number | WS3712361398-Doc3765641324 |
| Solicitation Number | WS3712361398 |
| Publication Date | November 25, 2022 |
| Tender Closing Date | December 12, 2022, 14:00:00 (EST) |
| Expected Contract Start Date | N/A |
| Expected Contract End Date | December 25, 2023 |
| Tender Status | Cancelled |
| GSIN | N/A |

### Description of Requirement
Natural Resources Canada is seeking a perimeter fence system as per the Statement of Requirement in the Request for Proposal. Deliveries must be made shore duty-paid in Ottawa, ON, for furtherance to Baker Lake, Nunavut.

### Additional Documents
* CR attaches the Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement, specifically the Nunavut Land Claim Agreement (NLCA), relevant to this procurement.

</details>

### Notice Type
This Tender Announcement is an open, invitation-to-bid, competitive tender with a conditional trade agreement clause. The selection of the winning bid will be carried out through the evaluation of the bid submitted, based on the information given in the requirements criteria as stated in this RFP.

### Request for Goods
The successful bidder will be required to deliver the Goods duty-paid at the specified destination in Ottawa, ON for furtherance at Baker Lake, Nunavut. Delivery details are clearly stated in the documentation package (Specifications).

### Trade Compliance
The procurement is conditionally limited to Canadian goods, relevant to local content restrictive goods as stated in the Comprehensive Trade Policy Act (former CCFTA, CFTA).

The procurement must comply with the specific Trade Agreements, which impacts the offering including Canadian content or wholly owned or majority-owned and permanently domestic companies in Canada or the execution of in-province or regional labours mong ED logistics HG-MM V assessment scales B papers Section wins COR breast serving assigned P-----
